comment: The class itself is boring and unclear, but Yang is a good teacher and grades fair. His personal formula sheets he gives out on test day is the answer key minus the numbers, so don't worry. I didn't study and only had chegg answers (never got the book) and i slept through class... got a b.

Yang is an energetic teacher and genuinely wants to help everyone understand. For this stat class he had really concise power point slides he used for lecture and posted on d2l. Grading wasn't very lenient and each of the 3 tests is 25% of your grade, but if you understand the hw you shouldn't have a too much trouble.

Dr. Yang  is an excellent professor and is very passionate with his teaching. His lectures were neat, clean, and clear for the most part. While there were some lectures that were hard to follow, he made sure the students understood before moving on. The tests (3 with one optional) were representative of the HW and class material. Would take again.

Dr. Yang does not specialize in this course which is mostly statistics but he really does try to teach it and he is not bad by any means. There are some lectures that do get confusing and he will make you understand no matter how long it takes so I admire him for that. 2 tests and a final. There was a 3rd optional exam that can replace a test.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Yang was a good lab professor. His lectures were clear cut and he was always straight to the point in what he wanted you to know. He set up the labs to where they didn't take too long, but you understood the concepts. Grading was fair, wasn't too harsh and wasn't too lenient. Just follow the directions and make them professional. You'll do fine.
Best Transportation Professor at KSU if you want to learn highway design the right way. His teaching method and practical examples are effective
1st year professor and he is doing a great job.  Very passionate about Transportation Engineering and it shows in his lectures.  Just needs some time under his belt and he will be a great professor.

This is his first semester teaching at SPSU. He is very knowledgeable and will share what he knows. His pronunciation in English is pretty good. He does expect students taking Highway Design to be well-versed in Transportation Engineering so be prepared.
